info.title: In•Process API
info.description: The In•Process API enables browsing and managing moments from timelines. Retrieve moments from a specific artist's timeline, browse the in•process collective timeline, or filter by collection. The API supports creating moments, managing collections, handling payments, and interacting with the In•Process protocol ecosystem.

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a Moment on the In•Process protocol, including onchain moment data, sales configuration, metadata, and moment admins.

parameters.name: collectionAddress
parameters.description: The contract address of the Moment

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: The token ID of the Moment

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Chain ID of the collection (default: Base, 8453)

post.description:
Create a new Moment on the In•Process protocol. No signature is required for this endpoint.

The API uses a unified `contract` object that supports both creating moments on existing collections and creating new collections:
- **Use existing collection**: Provide `contract.address` to add a moment to a collection you've already created
- **Create new collection**: Provide `contract.name` and `contract.uri` to create both a new collection and its first moment in a single request

Create a new Writing Moment on the In•Process protocol. No signature is required for this endpoint.

The API uses a unified `contract` object that supports both creating writing moments on existing collections and creating new collections:
- **Use existing collection**: Provide `contract.address` to add a writing moment to a collection you've already created
- **Create new collection**: Provide `contract.name` and `contract.uri` to create both a new collection and its first writing moment in a single request
Collect a Moment on the In•Process protocol. This endpoint allows users to collect moments with an optional comment.
Airdrop a Moment on the In•Process protocol. This endpoint allows artists to distribute moments to multiple recipients.

Add admin permissions to a Moment on the In•Process protocol. This endpoint allows artists to grant admin permissions to other addresses for managing their Moments.

**Note:** Only the current Moment admin can add permissions to other addresses. The transaction is executed via a smart account using Coinbase CDP.

delete.description:
Remove admin permissions from a Moment on the In•Process protocol. This endpoint allows artists to revoke admin permissions from addresses that were previously granted admin access to their Moments.

**Note:** Only the current Moment admin can remove permissions from other addresses. The transaction is executed via a smart account using Coinbase CDP.

post.description:
Update the URI (metadata) of an existing Moment on the In•Process protocol. This endpoint allows artists to update the metadata URI associated with their Moments.

**Note:** Only Moment admins can update the URI.

get.description: Retrieve Moment comments on the In•Process protocol. This endpoint returns comments associated with a specific moment.

parameters.name: collectionAddress
parameters.description: Moment contract address

parameters.name: tokenId
parameters.description: Token ID

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Chain ID (optional, default: Base, 8453)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Pagination offset (optional, defaults to 0)

post.description:
Migrate moments from social wallets to the artist's wallet. This endpoint finds all social wallets associated with the authenticated artist, retrieves collections from those social wallets, and migrates the moments to the artist's wallet.

**Note:** This endpoint requires authentication via API key.

get.description:
Browse collections from the In•Process protocol. This endpoint can retrieve collections from a specific artist or browse the in•process collective collections, depending on whether the `artist` parameter is provided. Supports pagination for efficient browsing.

**This is a public endpoint and does not require authentication.**

Endpoint behavior:
- When `artist` is provided: Returns collections from the specific artist (only collections created by that artist address).
- When `artist` is omitted: Returns collections from the in•process collective collections.

parameters.name: artist
parameters.description: Filter by artist address (collections created by this artist). When provided, returns the artist's collections. When omitted, returns the in•process collective collections.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records per page (max: 100)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve

parameters.name: chain_id
parameters.description: Filter by chain ID (default: Base chain, 8453)

post.description:
Create a new Collection on the In•Process protocol. This endpoint allows artists to create a new collection contract onchain.

**Note:** The collection is created onchain via a smart account transaction.

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a Collection on the In•Process protocol, including collection metadata, default admin, admins, payout recipient, and timestamps.

parameters.name: collectionAddress
parameters.description: The contract address of the Collection

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Chain ID of the collection (default: Base, 8453)

post.description:
Update the metadata (name and URI) of an existing Collection on the In•Process protocol. This endpoint allows artists to update the collection name and metadata URI associated with their Collections.

**Note:** Only Collection admins can update the metadata.

get.description:
Browse moments from timelines. This endpoint can retrieve moments from a specific artist's timeline or browse the in•process collective timeline, depending on whether the `artist` parameter is provided. Supports pagination for efficient browsing.

**This is a public endpoint and does not require authentication.**

Endpoint behavior:
- When `collection` is provided: Returns all moments (tokens) of the specified collection address.
- When `artist` is provided: Returns moments from the specific artist's timeline (only moments administered by that artist address). The `type` parameter can be used to filter by admin relationship.
- When both `artist` and `collection` are omitted: Returns moments from the in•process collective timeline (moments that are being created, indexed).

parameters.name: artist
parameters.description: Filter by admin address (only moments administered by this artist address). When provided, returns the artist timeline. When omitted, returns the in•process collective timeline.

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: Filter by collection address. When provided, returns all moments of the specified collection.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of records per page (max: 100)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to retrieve

parameters.name: chain_id
parameters.description: Filter by chain ID (default: Base chain, 8453)

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If true, includes moments marked as hidden by the admin (default: false)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Only applicable when `artist` is provided. Determines whether to show moments where the artist is the default admin (`default`), moments co-administered with others (`mutual`), or both when not provided.

get.description:
Retrieve payment records from the In•Process protocol. Supports filtering by artist and collector addresses.

**This is a public endpoint and does not require authentication.**

Endpoint behavior:
- If no parameters are provided: Returns the latest payment records.
- If `collector` is provided: Payments are filtered so the purchaser is the provided address.
- If `artist` is provided: Filters where the token creator is the provided address.

parameters.name: artist
parameters.description: Filter by artist address (payments for tokens created by this artist)

parameters.name: collector
parameters.description: Filter by collector address (payments where this address is the buyer)

buyer.bio: Digital artist exploring the intersection of technology and creativity

post.description:
Distribute payments from a split contract. This endpoint allows you to trigger the distribution of payment tokens (native or ERC20) from a split contract to its recipients according to their configured allocations.

**This is a public endpoint and does not require authentication.**

get.description:
Retrieve notification records from the In•Process protocol. Supports filtering by artist address and viewed status.

**This is a public endpoint and does not require authentication.**

Endpoint behavior:
- If no parameters are provided: Returns the latest notification records.
- If `artist` is provided: Filters notifications where the artist is the provided address.
- If `viewed` is provided: Filters notifications by their viewed status (true for viewed, false for unviewed).

parameters.name: artist
parameters.description: Filter by artist address (notifications for this artist)

parameters.name: viewed
parameters.description: Filter by viewed status (true for viewed, false for unviewed)

buyer.bio: Passionate collector of digital art and NFTs

artist.bio: Digital artist exploring the intersection of technology and creativity

get.description:
Retrieve Artist airdrop information on the In•Process protocol. This endpoint returns a list of airdrops for a specific artist address, including collection addresses, token IDs, recipients, and amounts.

**This is a public endpoint and does not require authentication.**

parameters.name: artist_address
parameters.description: Artist address

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Chain ID (default: Base, 8453)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Pagination offset (default: 0)

post.description:
Create a new API key for artists on the In•Process protocol.

**Overview:**

Artists can create API keys in two ways:

1. **Programmatically** - Using the API endpoint documented below
2. **Via Web Interface** - Using the [In•Process API Keys Management Site](https://inprocess.world/manage/api-keys)

The web interface provides a user-friendly way to create, view, and manage an artist API keys without writing code.

**Note:** This endpoint requires a Privy access token for authentication. Privy access tokens are obtained through the Privy authentication flow and provide secure access to artist-specific API endpoints. For more information about Privy authentication, see the [Privy documentation](https://docs.privy.io/authentication/user-authentication/access-tokens#getting-the-access-token).

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing Privy access token

post.description: Connect a social wallet and an artist wallet on the In•Process protocol.

delete.description: Disconnect a social wallet and an artist wallet on the In•Process protocol.

get.description: Get an artist wallet associated with a social wallet on the In•Process protocol.

parameters.name: social_wallet
parameters.description: The address of a social wallet

get.description: Retrieve a message by its unique ID. Returns the message content, metadata, and any associated moment data.

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) of the message to retrieve

400.description: Bad request - Invalid message ID format

get.description:
Get a smart wallet connected to an artist wallet on the In•Process protocol. This endpoint retrieves the smart wallet address associated with a given artist wallet address.

**This is a public endpoint and does not require authentication.**

parameters.name: artist_wallet
parameters.description: The artist wallet address to get a smart wallet for

post.description: Withdraw funds from a smart wallet. Supports both native ETH and USDC tokens. If amount is not provided, the full balance will be withdrawn. The withdrawal may span multiple smart wallets associated with the artist.

errors.message: Amount must be a valid positive number

401.description: Unauthorized - Missing or invalid bearer token

example.message: Failed to withdraw from smart wallet

get.description: Get balances of all social smart wallets associated with an artist address. Returns ETH and USDC balances for each social smart wallet, along with total balances across all wallets.

parameters.name: artist_address
parameters.description: The artist wallet address to get balances for

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Chain ID of the network (default: Base, 8453)

post.description:
Connect a phone number for artists on the In•Process protocol. After connection, a verification SMS message will be sent to the provided phone number.

**Overview:**

Artists can connect their phone number to enable SMS-based features and notifications.

1. An SMS verification message is automatically sent to the provided phone number.
   
   For example:
   
   > Someone is trying to connect this phone number to the artist profile for sweetman.eth on In•Process. If this was you, please reply 'yes'. If this was not you, please ignore this message.

2. If the artist replies "yes", the artist's phone number will be verified.
3. With a verified phone number the artist can create new Moments via SMS.

example.message: Phone number connected and verification message sent

400.description: Validation error - Invalid request body or phone number format

500.description: Server error - Failed to connect phone number or send SMS

delete.description:
Disconnect a phone number from an artist's profile on the In•Process protocol. This will remove the phone number association and disable SMS-based features for that number.

**Note:** Disconnecting a phone number will remove it from the artist's profile. After disconnection, SMS-based features will no longer be available for that phone number. The phone number can be re-connected later if needed.

500.description: Server error - Failed to disconnect phone number

moments.description: List of moments in the timeline

max_supply.description: Maximum supply of tokens (null if unlimited)

admins.description: Array of currently active admin objects. The default admin appears here only if they still have admin permissions.

created_at.description: ISO timestamp when the moment was created

updated_at.description: ISO timestamp when the moment metadata was updated

DefaultAdmin.description: The original admin set at collection creation (always present, preserves historical record)

address.description: Address of the original default admin

username.description: Username of the default admin, if available

hidden.description: Whether the moment is hidden by the default admin

username.description: Username of the admin/artist, if available

hidden.description: Whether the moment is hidden by this admin

chainId.description: Chain ID where the collection exists

created_at.description: ISO timestamp when the collection was created

updated_at.description: ISO timestamp when the collection was updated

CollectionDefaultAdmin.description: Original admin set at collection creation

username.description: Username of the default admin, if available

account.description: Creator's address (will be used as default admin)

uri.description: Metadata URI for the Collection (e.g., Arweave URI)

splits.description: Optional revenue sharing configuration. If provided, must have at least 2 recipients and sum to 100%

contractAddress.description: The address of the newly created Collection

hash.description: Transaction hash of the creation operation

chainId.description: Chain ID where the transaction was executed

chain_id.description: Chain ID where the collection exists

admins.description: Array of addresses with admin permissions

created_at.description: ISO timestamp when the collection was created

updated_at.description: ISO timestamp when the collection was updated

hash.description: Transaction hash of the update operation

chainId.description: Chain ID where the transaction was executed

pricePerToken.description: Price per token in wei (18 decimals). For example, "100000000000000000" represents 0.1 ETH

saleStart.description: Unix timestamp as a string indicating when the sale starts

saleEnd.description: Unix timestamp as a string indicating when the sale ends

currency.description: Optional ERC20 token address. If not provided, defaults to the native token (ETH)

owner.description: Current owner address of the moment

momentAdmins.description: Array of addresses with admin permissions

contract.description: Contract object. If address is provided, uses existing collection. If name and uri are provided, creates new collection.

address.description: Optional: Address of existing collection (if provided, uses existing collection)

name.description: Optional: Collection name (required if address is not provided)

uri.description: Optional: Collection metadata URI (required if address is not provided)

tokenMetadataURI.description: The URI pointing to the token's metadata (e.g., Arweave URI)

createReferral.description: The address that will receive referral rewards for this moment creation

mintToCreatorCount.description: Number of tokens to mint to the creator upon creation (typically 1)

payoutRecipient.description: Optional address that will receive sale proceeds. If splits are configured, this will be automatically set to the splits contract address

maxSupply.description: Optional maximum number of tokens that can be minted. Must be an integer >= 1. If not provided, the token will be an open edition with unlimited supply

splits.description: Optional revenue splits configuration. Must have at least 2 recipients and sum to 100%

contract.description: Contract object. If address is provided, uses existing collection. If name and uri are provided, creates new collection.

address.description: Optional: Address of existing collection (if provided, uses existing collection)

name.description: Optional: Collection name (required if address is not provided)

uri.description: Optional: Collection metadata URI (required if address is not provided)

tokenContent.description: Writing content for the token (e.g., "Hello world")

mintToCreatorCount.description: Number of tokens to mint to creator (usually 1)

payoutRecipient.description: Optional address to receive sale proceeds (defaults to creator if not provided)

splits.description: Optional revenue splits configuration. Must have at least 2 recipients and sum to 100%

contractAddress.description: The address of the collection (newly created or existing)

tokenId.description: The token ID of the created moment

hash.description: Transaction hash of the creation operation

chainId.description: Chain ID where the transaction was executed

recipients.description: Array of recipients to receive the airdrop

tokenId.description: TokenId of the moment to airdrop

collectionAddress.description: Contract address of the moment collection

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp of when the comment was made

adminAddress.description: Address to grant admin permissions to
Address to revoke admin permissions from

chainId.description: Chain ID where the transaction was executed
Chain ID for the migration (optional, defaults to Base, 8453)

results.description: Array of transaction objects for each migration operation

block.description: Block number where the transaction occurred

chainId.description: Chain ID where the token exists

createdAt.description: ISO timestamp when the token was created

viewed.description: Whether the notification has been viewed

created_at.description: ISO timestamp when the notification was created

splitAddress.description: The address of the split contract to distribute from

tokenAddress.description: The address of the token to distribute (optional, defaults to zero address for native token)

chainId.description: Chain ID where the split contract exists (default: Base, 8453)

address.description: Smart wallet address connected to the artist wallet

currency.description: The currency to withdraw. Use "eth" for native ETH or "usdc" for USDC tokens.

amount.description: The amount to withdraw in human-readable token units (not base units/wei). Must be a valid positive number as a string. For example, use "0.1" for 0.1 ETH, not "100000000000000000" (which is 0.1 ETH in wei). For ERC20 tokens, use the token's decimal precision (e.g., "100.5" for 100.5 USDC if USDC has 6 decimals). If not provided, the full balance will be withdrawn.

to.description: The recipient address where the funds will be sent

chainId.description: Chain ID where the withdrawal will be executed. Optional parameter - if not provided, defaults to Base (8453).

withdrawals.description: Array of withdrawal results, one for each smart wallet that was used

remainingTotalEthBalance.description: Total remaining ETH balance across all smart wallets after withdrawal

remainingTotalUsdcBalance.description: Total remaining USDC balance across all smart wallets after withdrawal

hash.description: Transaction hash of the withdrawal. May be null if the withdrawal failed or was skipped.

chainId.description: Chain ID where the transaction was executed

walletAddress.description: Address of the smart wallet from which funds were withdrawn

withdrawnAmount.description: Amount withdrawn from this wallet in human-readable token units

remainingAmount.description: Remaining balance in this wallet after withdrawal in human-readable token units

balances.description: Array of balance information for each social smart wallet

total_eth_balance.description: Total ETH balance across all social smart wallets

total_usdc_balance.description: Total USDC balance across all social smart wallets

smart_wallet.description: Address of the smart wallet associated with the social wallet

eth_balance.description: ETH balance in human-readable token units

usdc_balance.description: USDC balance in human-readable token units

collectionAddress.description: Collection address of the airdropped moment

tokenId.description: Token ID of the airdropped moment

phone_number.description: Phone number in E.164 format (e.g., "+1234567890" or "+14155552671")

success.description: Indicates whether the operation was successful

message.description: A descriptive message about the operation result

success.description: Indicates whether the operation was successful

message.description: A descriptive message about the operation result

success.description: Indicates whether the operation was successful

social_wallet.description: The social wallet address to disconnect

success.description: Indicates whether the operation was successful

address.description: Artist wallet address associated with social wallet

key_name.description: A descriptive name for the API key

key.description: The generated API key for the artist

id.description: Unique identifier for the message metadata

artist_address.description: The wallet address of the artist associated with this message

client.description: The client that created this message (e.g., telegram, web, api)

created_at.description: Timestamp when the message metadata was created

uri.description: Metadata URI of the collection (e.g., ar://...)

chain_id.description: Chain ID where the collection is deployed

created_at.description: Timestamp when the collection was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the collection was last updated

default_admin.description: Default admin wallet address for the collection

payout_recipient.description: Wallet address that receives payouts from the collection

uri.description: Metadata URI of the moment (e.g., ar://...)

token_id.description: Token ID of the moment within the collection

created_at.description: Timestamp when the moment was created

max_supply.description: Maximum supply of tokens for this moment

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the moment was last updated

role.description: The role of the message sender

errors.description: Optional array of field-level validation errors. Typically included in 400 Bad Request responses for validation errors.

field.description: The field name that failed validation

message.description: The validation error message for this field

apiKeyAuth.name: x-api-key
apiKeyAuth.description: Artist API key for authentication. Get your API key from https://inprocess.world/manage/api-keys
